page.title: 06HOLLINGBURY FARM CAPEL
page.content: Hollingbury Farm is a 110 acre arable and beef herd farm in Capel. Mrs.Daniels,the farmer's wife showed us around the farm and told us about the machinery.We saw a combine harvester, 2 tractors,a snowplough and the augers which suck up hay or straw and separate them. 1 acre costs Â£1500-Â£2000. Cropping is on a 4 year rotation;2 years of wheat; 1 of barley and then either 1 of oilseed rape or 1 of beans.The oil from oilseed rape is used in margarine The flour from wheat is used for bread and spaghetti.Barley is either shipped to deprived countries,or used for animal feed.Beans are used for cattle feed or pigeon meal.They also have grass fields which are cut for hay and used to feed the animals in winter. Afterwards Mrs.Daniels gave us drinks.
